questionTask.text: What are the criteria for promotions to the rank of Associate Professor with tenure at Stanford?
How can former students provide feedback on a faculty member's suitability for promotion?
What topics can former students address in their feedback on a faculty member's suitability for promotion?

statementsTask.text:
The criteria for promotions to the rank of Associate Professor with tenure at Stanford include evidence of outstanding research contributions and being among the best in the field. Additionally, faculty members are expected to be educators, advising graduate students and directing student research. There is also a confidential review process that includes feedback on teaching ability and curriculum development, as well as overall approach as an advisor and mentor. Former students are given the opportunity to express their opinions on the professor.
